Course Name: EXERCISE LEADERSHIP FOR THE OLDER ADULT
Description:
(Cross-listed with EXSC 40612) Designed to provide the students with a knowledge base in exercise leadership
in the senior population and includes special populations. Students participate in the leading supervision and
evaluation of the participant within the exercise program. They also assist in the collection of functional fitness
data.

Course Name: EXERCISE IMPLEMENTATION: AN EXERCISE INTERVENTION PROGRAM
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) Students will participate in leading, supervising and developing plans for individuals who
want to reduce cardiovascular risk factors through structured exercise.

Course Name: VARIABEL TITLE WORKSHOP IN EXERCISE SCIENCE AND EXERCISE PHYSIOLOGY
Description: (Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with EXSC 43093) Workshop in exercise science or physiology, topics vary.

(Cross-listed with EXSC 45065) Lecture and laboratory experiences dealing with the administration and
interpretation of exercise tests.

(Cross-listed with EXSC 45070) Designed to provide students with the knowledge base in electrocardiography.
Studetns work on interpretting the 12-lead electrocardiogram with clinical case studies to enhance the
knowledge base of the exercise specialist.

(Cross-listed with EXSC 45080) Physiological bases of muscular activity with special attention to general effects
of exercise on body function. Laboratory included.

Course Name: PHYSIOLOGY OF AGING:IMPLICATIONS FOR HUMAN BEHAVIOR
Description:
(Cross-listed with EXPH 70610) Examine physiological changes which accompany advancing age. Special
attention is paid to the effect of these changes on sensory motor and cognitive behavior.

Course Name: RESEARCH PROCESS IN ATHLETIC TRAINING AND EXERCISE PHYSIOLOGY
Description:
(Cross-listed with EXPH 73050) The research process and statistical concepts applied to athletic training and
exercise physiology.

Course Name: QUANTITATIVE AND RESEARCH METHODS IN ATHLETIC TRAINING AND EXERCISE
Description:
PHYSIOLOGY
(Cross-listed with EXPH 73051) Research design and statistical methods applied to exercise, physiology and
athletic training.

Course Name: ADVANCED RESEARCH DESIGN AND STATISTICS IN EXERCISE PHYSIOLOGY
Description:
(Cross-listed with EXPH 73052) Advanced topics in research design and statistical analysis with computer
applications in exercise physiology.

(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ATTR 63095 and ATTR 73095 and EXPH 73095 and SRM 63095 and
SRM 73095) Presentation and discussion of research by faculty and students. A total of 2 credits may be applied
toward degree requirements.

(Repeatable for a maximum of 6 credit hours) (Cross-listed with EXPH 73096) Independent study completed
under the supervision of a faculty member. Written approval of supervising faculty member and School Director
required prior to registration.

(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ATTR 63098 and SRM 63098 and EXPH 83098) Research or individual
investigation.

Course Name: VARIABLE TITLE WORKSHOP IN EXERCISE PHYSIOLOGY
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Workshop in exercise physiology; topics vary. Maximum 4 hours applied to the degree.

(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with EXPH 73195) Selected and varied topics of relevance in exercise
physiology.

(Cross-listed with ATTR 63199 and SRM 63199)Thesis students must register for a total of 6 hours, 2 to 6 hours
in a semester distributed over several semesters if desired.

(Cross-listed with ATTR 63299 and SRM 63299)Thesis students must continue registration each semester until
all degree requirements are met.

(Cross-listed with EXPH 75075) Characteristics of skeletal muscle related to contraction during exercise,
strength, elasticity, fatigue, and training. Electromyograph analysis of muscle function emphasized.

(Slashed with EXPH 75076) Effects of heat, cold, pressure, pollution and psychological stress upon physiological
responses to exercise. Lecture and laboratory.

Course Name: PHYSIOLOGICAL BASIS OF EXERCISE AND SPORT
Description:
(Cross-listed with EXPH 75080) Application of physiological concepts to human performance. Includes role of
testing, training strength and endurance, nutritional considerations, environmental influences and,adapted
exercise programs.

(Cross-listed with EXPH 75081) Measurement of metabolic response to exercise. Topics include ergometry
spirometry energy expenditure body composition and performance correlates of strength power and endurance.

(Cross-listed with EXPH 75082) Measurement of the cardiovascular-respiratory response to exercise. Includes
resting spirometry, lung function during exercise, electrocardiography, blood pressure, PWC testing and exercise
prescription.

(Cross-listed with EXPH 75083) Energy transformations during exercise. Emphasis on controlling mechanisms
that regulate the anabolic and catabolic responses to both acute and chronic exercise.

(Cross-listed with EXPH 75084) Responses of the cardiovascular and respiratory systems to exercise. Use of
noninvasive methods to measure cardio-respiratory function emphasized. Lecture and laboratory.

(Cross-listed with EXPH 75086) Provide students with knowledge to understand the role of the muscular and
nervous systems in human movement and exercise. Motor disorders and rehabilitation techniques will also be
discussed. Lecture and laboratory.

(Repeatable for a maximum of 8 credit hours) (Cross-listed with EXPH 75192) Field experience in exercise
physiology programs and testing in Kent State University adult fitness program or cooperating agencies.

Course Name: PHYSIOLOGY OF AGING:IMPLICATIONS FOR HUMAN BEHAVIOR
Description:
(Cross-listed with EXPH 60610) Examine physiological changes which accompany advancing age. Special
attention is paid to the effect of these changes on sensory motor and cognitive behavior.

Course Name: RESEARCH PROCESSES IN ATHLETIC TRAINING AND EXERCISE PHYSIOLOGY
Description:
(Cross-listed with EXPH 63050) The research process and statistical concepts applied to athletic training and
exercise physiology.

Course Name: QUANTITATIVE AND RESEARCH METHODS IN ATHLETIC TRAINING AND EXERCISE
Description:
PHYSIOLOGY
(Cross-listed with EXPH 63051) Research design and statistical methods applied to exercise physiology and
athletic training.

Course Name: ADVANCED RESEARCH DESIGN AND STATISTICS IN EXERCISE PHYSIOLOGY
Prerequisites: EXPH 63051 or EXPH 73051 and doctoral standing.
Description:
(Cross-listed with EXPH 63052) Advanced topics in research design and statistical analysis with computer
applications in exercise physiology.

(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ATTR 63095 and ATTR 73095 and EXPH 63095 and SRM 63095 and
SRM 73095) Presentation and discussion of research by faculty and students. A total of 2 credits may be applied
toward degree requirements.

(Repeatable for a maximum of 6 credit hours) (Cross-listed with EXPH 63096) Independent student completed
under the supervision of a faculty member. Written approval of supervising faculty member and School Director
required prior to registration.

(Repeatable for a maximum of 6 credit hours) (Cross-listed with EXPH 63195) Selected an varied topics of
relevance in exercise physiology.
(Cross-listed with ) Survey of biomechanics, with particular emphasis on skeletal muscle mechanics.

strength, elasticity, fatigue and training. Electromyograph analysis of muscle function emphasized.

(Slashed with EXPH 65076) Effects of heat, cold, pressure, pollution and psychological stress upon physiological
responses to exercise. Lecture and laboratory.

Field experience in exercise physiology programs and testing in KSU adult fitness program or cooperating
agencies.
(Repeatable for credit)Research for doctoral students.

(Repeatable for credit)Doctoral dissertation, for which registration in at least two semesters is required, first of
which will be semester in which dissertation work is begun and continuing until the completion of 30 hours.

(Repeatable for credit)Continuing registration required of doctoral students who have completed the initial 30
